definition: to admire sb's reputation/to seek out famous person or location
to admire
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people
to come to a place on account of its reputation (idiom); attracted to visit a famous location

sentences.english: The performances were really a big hit and drew in large crowds.
sentences.chinese: 表演太成功了，很多人都慕名而來觀看。

sentences.english: It has its own international airport and some 20,000 tourists every year.
sentences.chinese: 當地建有國際機場，每年約有2萬遊客慕名而至。

sentences.english: Moreover, tourists often come and have picnics here, because of its beauty.
sentences.chinese: 要命的是，遊客們慕名而來，經常燒烤野炊。

sentences.english: Have the news inside course of study " dragon definitely " disgraced, large quantities of ghoul admire names find treasure.
sentences.chinese: 有業內消息“龍決”現世，大批盜墓者慕名尋寶。

sentences.english: Most visitors make for the eponymous central temple.
sentences.chinese: 大部分遊客慕名去了同名的中區寺廟。

sentences.english: Compared with his dramatic works, Yeats's poems attract much admiring notice.
sentences.chinese: 他的戲劇作品相比，葉芝的詩歌吸引慕名而來的通知。

sentences.english: Most of the restaurant's new customers come from word of mouth.
sentences.chinese: 這間餐廳大部分的新顧客都是慕名而來。

definition: to come to a place on account of its reputation (idiom); attracted to visit a famous location
continuously; in an endless stream (idiom)
make light of traveling a thousand li/go to the trouble of traveling a long distance
to come (formal)/before/previously
front yard as busy as a marketplace (idiom)/a place with many visitors
specifically/specially (for that purpose)
to take all one's family along (idiom); encumbered by a family/tied down by family obligations
to rush like ducks (idiom); the mob scrabbles madly for sth unobtainable/an unruly crowd on a wild goose chase
to come thick and fast (idiom)
to pay a visit/to call on
from distant parts
crowded with visitors/packed with tourists
to inquire after/to look for (sb)
seasoned/honed to perfection over centuries/special reserve
to fall over each other in their eagerness to...
to look/to have a glimpse at/to observe (sth's splendor)
